harp is angel music

Think I found my favorite artist: Edmar Castaneda first heard it on NPR's tiny desk concert: 

then i did more research. you can read a bit about his back story on the NPR website: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=101893754

there are two lines on this page.
if you want more music at this point then you listen to his stint at a jazz festival with his trio composed of harp, trombone and percussion: http://www.npr.org/templates/player/mediaPlayer.html?action=1&t=1&islist=false&id=101893754&m=102223530
if you want to listen to his accented-voice talking about his heartwarming story: http://www.npr.org/templates/player/mediaPlayer.html?action=1&t=1&islist=false&id=101893754&m=102223530

supplemental listening excercises: 
Edmar playing in a traditional colombian group. opening part with congo + harp = beautiful.
